cnd22:1.1: <em>141 : "The distorted view has been cast off,
cnd22:1.2: The decision has been reached, the way has been obtained,
cnd22:1.3: I have arisen knowledge and will not be guided by others":
cnd22:1.4: So saying, one should walk alone like a rhinoceros.
cnd22:1.5: <em>141 : "The distorted view has been cast off,
cnd22:1.6: The decision has been reached, the way has been obtained,
cnd22:1.7: I have arisen knowledge and will not be guided by others":
cnd22:1.8: So saying, one should walk alone like a rhinoceros.
cnd22:1.9: <em>141 : "The distorted view has been cast off,
cnd22:1.10: The decision has been reached, the way has been obtained,
cnd22:1.11: I have arisen knowledge and will not be guided by others":
cnd22:1.12: So saying, one should walk alone like a rhinoceros.
cnd22:1.13: <em>141 : "The distorted view has been cast off,
cnd22:1.14: The decision has been reached, the way has been obtained,
cnd22:1.15: I have arisen knowledge and will not be guided by others":
cnd22:1.16: So saying, one should walk alone like a rhinoceros.
cnd22:2.1: "The distorted view has been cast off": The distorted view is called the Twenty
cnd22:2.2: Dependent Views. Here, the ordinary people who have not heard of the Holy One,
cnd22:2.3: have never seen the saints, those who are not proficient in the Dhamma, and have
cnd22:2.4: not been trained in the Dhamma; they have never seen the Dhamma of good people,
cnd22:2.5: are unskilled in the Dhamma, and have not been trained in the good Dhamma. They
cnd22:2.6: think that form is self, or 'I' have form, or form is in 'me,' or 'I' am in
cnd22:2.8: distorted views. "The distorted view has been shaken off": The distorted view
cnd22:2.9: has been shaken off, has been surpassed, has been traversed, has been
cnd22:3.1: "The decision has been reached, the way has been obtained": The four (holy) ways
cnd22:3.2: (Paths) are called decisions. Those who possess the four noble paths have
cnd22:3.3: reached, fully reached, and decision that has been reached. "The path has been
cnd22:3.4: obtained," He has gained the Path, has obtained the Path, has reached the Path,
cnd22:4.1: "I am the one who has arisen wisdom and will not be guided by other people": The
cnd22:4.2: wisdom of the one who has been enlightened has arisen, has been fully arisen,
cnd22:4.3: has been born, has been produced, has appeared: "All actions are impermanent"
cnd22:4.4: has arisen... (omitted), "all deeds are suffering"..., "all dhammas are without
cnd22:4.5: self"..., "any collection of dhammas is an extinction"...."Won't be guided by
cnd22:4.6: other people," that alone-enlightened person is one who is not guided by others,
cnd22:4.7: does not depend on others, does not rely on others, has arrived to not being
cnd22:4.8: bound by others, he knows and sees truthfully, is not ignorant, the right
cnd22:4.9: knower, and the rememberer: "All actions are impermanent," he is a person who is
cnd22:5.1: <em>142 : Those who do not have greed, deceit, or desire,
cnd22:5.2: Those who do not hide evil, those who have eliminated evil and delusions,
cnd22:5.3: After becoming one who has left his wishes in all the world,
cnd22:5.4: One should walk alone like a rhinoceros.
cnd22:5.5: <em>142 : Those who do not have greed, deceit, or desire,
cnd22:5.6: Those who do not hide evil, those who have eliminated evil and delusions,
cnd22:5.7: After becoming one who has left his wishes in all the world,
cnd22:5.8: One should walk alone like a rhinoceros.
cnd22:5.9: <em>142 : Those who do not have greed, deceit, or desire,
cnd22:5.10: Those who do not hide evil, those who have eliminated evil and delusions,
cnd22:5.11: After becoming one who has left his wishes in all the world,
cnd22:5.12: One should walk alone like a rhinoceros.
cnd22:5.13: <em>142 : Those who do not have greed, deceit, or desire,
cnd22:5.14: Those who do not hide evil, those who have eliminated evil and delusions,
cnd22:5.15: After becoming one who has left his wishes in all the world,
cnd22:5.16: One should walk alone like a rhinoceros.
cnd22:6.1: "Those who are not greedy, who are not deceitful, and those who are not
cnd22:6.2: craving": Greed is called craving, that is greed, lust, acquiescence,
cnd22:6.3: conformity, joy, desire, obsession, taking, contaminated, disturbance, fraud,
cnd22:6.4: (reincarnation) root cause, (bitter) fertility, tailoring (greed), net, river,
cnd22:6.5: bondage, rope, attachment, accumulation, companionship, desire, intimate
cnd22:6.6: interaction, forest, jungle, love, expectation, relationship, desire for form,
cnd22:6.7: desire for sounds, desire for smells, desire for tastes, desire for touches,
cnd22:6.8: desire for acquisition, desire for wealth, desire for sons, desire for life, the
cnd22:6.9: state of desire, hope, prayer, greedy appearance, possessing greed, inquiring
cnd22:6.10: for profit, illegal greed, improper greed, hope, envy, desire for desire, desire
cnd22:6.11: for nothingness, desire for form, formless thirst, extinguished thirst, form
cnd22:6.12: thirst, sound thirst, smell thirst, taste thirst, touch thirst, dhamma thirst,
cnd22:6.13: torrent, harness, binding, clinging, obstacles, covering, defilements, potential
cnd22:6.14: trends of troubles, entanglement, vines, stinginess, suffering roots, causes of
cnd22:6.15: suffering, occurrence of suffering, magical nets, magical hooks, magical food,
cnd22:6.16: the realm of the devil, the residence of the devil, the state of the devil, the
cnd22:6.17: bondage of the devil, the river of thirst, the net of thirst, the rope of
cnd22:6.18: thirst, the sea of thirst, craving, greed, and the root of unwholesomeness. That
cnd22:6.19: greed, craving, for the alone-enlightened person, has been cut off, the root has
cnd22:6.20: been cut off just like a palm tree without roots, becoming non-existent, a
cnd22:6.21: non-living thing for the future, so the Buddha is the undisturbed. In the
cnd22:6.22: disturbed state of disconnection, the Blessed One does not waver; does not shake
cnd22:6.23: when he does not get it (obtain something); does not shake when he has
cnd22:6.24: reputation; does not shake when he has no reputation; does not shake with
cnd22:6.25: praise; does not shake with reprimand; does not shake at times; does not shake,
cnd22:6.26: does not move, does not tremble. Therefore, the alone-enlightened person is the
cnd22:7.1: "Non-deceitful," there are three types of deceit): deceit to use resources,
cnd22:7.2: deceit of deportment, and deceit of talking all around for gain.
cnd22:8.1: What is the trickery of using resources? Here, the homeowners invite the
cnd22:8.2: bhikkhus with clothes, food, shelter, patients' necessities, and medical
cnd22:8.3: necessities. He is a person with evil desire, a person with a desire for nature,
cnd22:8.4: and a person with hope. He is a person who has clothes, food, shelter,
cnd22:8.5: necessities of the patient, and medical necessities. Hoping for more and
cnd22:8.6: rejecting clothes, refusal to give food, refusal to shelter, refusal of
cnd22:8.7: patients' necessities and medical necessities, he said: "What do high-value
cnd22:8.8: clothes have for a Samaṇa!" It is appropriate that a Samaṇa should use rags from
cnd22:8.9: the mound room or garbage dump or in front of the shop to make coats of. What
cnd22:8.10: does high-value food mean to a Samaṇa! It is appropriate that a Samaṇa should
cnd22:8.11: survive by wandering for alms. What is there for a Samaṇa with high-value
cnd22:8.12: accommodation! ...A Samaṇa should be those who live under the trees or between
cnd22:8.13: the mounds or live in the open. ...needs of patients and medical necessities!
cnd22:8.14: ...should use medicine of fermented cow urine or crushed greens. After grasping
cnd22:8.15: that, he wears coarse clothes; receives coarse food; lives in coarse dwellings;
cnd22:8.16: uses coarse patients' necessities and medical necessities. The homeowners knew
cnd22:8.17: him this way: "This Samaṇa is a person with little desire, a contented person, a
cnd22:8.18: lonely person, a person who is away from the masses, a person whose vitality has
cnd22:8.19: been activated, and a teacher." They invite more and more with with clothes,
cnd22:8.20: food, shelter, patients' necessities, and medical necessities. He said: "The
cnd22:8.21: three current states have faithful men who produce a lot of merit: the current
cnd22:8.22: state of faith has faithful men, the current state that produces a lot of merit
cnd22:8.23: and donation has a believing man who produces a lot of merit, and the current
cnd22:8.24: state of a person worthy of support has a believing man who produces a lot of
cnd22:8.25: merit. You are the believer, and the charity exists (is found), and I am the
cnd22:8.26: receiver. If I don't accept it, then you will become outsiders of merit. This is
cnd22:8.27: not necessary for me, but just for pity, from you, I accept." After clinging to
cnd22:8.28: that, he accepts many clothes, many foods, many residences, and many patients'
cnd22:8.29: necessities and medical necessities. The frowning of anyone who frowns like this
cnd22:8.30: is the path of deceit, the state of deceit, this is deceit to gain resources.
cnd22:9.1: What is the trickery of deportment? Here, there are certain types of evil
cnd22:9.2: desirers, those who desire nature, and those who desire respect, (thought): "In
cnd22:9.3: this way, people will respect me." He placed to walk, placed to stand, placed to
cnd22:9.4: sit, placed to lie down, walked for desire, stood for desire, sat down for
cnd22:9.5: desire, lay down for desire, walked like a person in concentration, as in
cnd22:9.6: concentration he stands, sits down like a meditation person, lies down like a
cnd22:9.7: meditation person, and becomes visible as a meditator. The placement,
cnd22:9.8: strengthening, and complete placement of behaviors like this; the frown of this
cnd22:9.9: frowning person is the path of trickery and the state of trickery, this is the
cnd22:10.1: What is the trickery of talking all around for gain? Here, there are certain
cnd22:10.2: types of evil desirers, those who desire nature, and those who desire respect,
cnd22:10.3: (thought): "In this way, people will respect me." He spoke according to the Holy
cnd22:10.4: Dhamma, and he said: "Whoever dresses like this is a powerful Samaṇa." He said:
cnd22:10.5: "Anyone who holds a bowl like this..., holding a copper bowl..., holding a water
cnd22:10.6: filter..., water filter, keys, wearing shoe, a belt, ...is a Samaṇa of great
cnd22:10.7: power." He said: "Whoever his followers are like this, he is a powerful Samaṇa."
cnd22:10.8: He said: "Whoever his teacher is like this..., the equivalent of a bhikkhu is
cnd22:10.9: like this..., the equivalent of a teacher, a friend, an acquaintance, a close
cnd22:10.10: person, a companion..., he is a powerful Samaṇa." He said: "Anyone who lives in
cnd22:10.11: a dwelling like this..., in a half-roof house, in a tall building, in a flat
cnd22:10.12: house, in a cave, living in a cave, a hut, a heavy pavilion, an observatory,
cnd22:10.13: round house, a shed, a lecture hall, a tent, living under a tree..., he is the
cnd22:11.1: Or, those who keep frowning; constantly frowning; those who keep tricking; those
cnd22:11.2: who keep nagging; those who are respected because of their mouths, who says such
cnd22:11.3: deep, secret, subtle, out-of-the-world, and empty talk: "This Samaṇa gets this
cnd22:11.4: quiet residence like this and waits." The frown of anyone who frowns like this;
cnd22:11.5: the path of the trick, the state of the trick, this is the trickery of the
cnd22:11.6: surrounding language. For the alone-enlightened person, these three types of
cnd22:11.7: tricks: tricks with money (resources), tricks with deportment, and tricks with
cnd22:11.8: of speaking around for gain, have been cut off, calmed down, stopped, can't
cnd22:11.9: arise and burned by the fire of wisdom, therefore, the alone-enlightened one is
cnd22:12.1: "Those who have no desire," desire is called thirst, which is greed.... The
cnd22:12.2: longing, the thirsting, has been cut off for the enlightened one, and the roots
cnd22:12.3: have been cut off.... Therefore, the one enlightened one is the one without
cnd22:13.1: "Those who do not hide the evil, have eliminated the filth and delusions":
cnd22:13.2: "Hiding evil" refers to all acts of hiding evil, hypocrisy, and jealousy.
cnd22:13.3: "Filth" refers to greed, vulgarity, obscenity, sordid filth, anger...,
cnd22:13.4: resentment..., hiding evil..., domineering..., all unwholesome contrived things.
cnd22:13.5: "Ignorance" is ignorance in suffering, ignorance in the path leading to
cnd22:13.6: suffering, ignorance in the past, ignorance in the future, in the past and the
cnd22:13.7: future, the ignorance of the specific conditionality and the conditioned state,
cnd22:13.8: all such ignorance, not seeing, not being aware, not enlightening, not
cnd22:13.9: understanding, not firmly understanding, not to see correctly, not to examine,
cnd22:13.10: bad wisdom, obsession, the torrent of ignorance, harness of ignorance, potential
cnd22:13.11: trend of trouble of ignorance, entanglement of ignorance, the fence of
cnd22:13.12: ignorance, the root of ignorance. For that alone-enlightened person, hiding evil
cnd22:13.13: and filth and ignorance has been spit out, has been spit out completely, has
cnd22:13.14: been eliminated, has been cut off.... The alone-enlightened person is the one
cnd22:13.15: who does not hide the evil, and has eliminated the filth and delusion.
cnd22:14.1: "Becoming one who has left the desire in all the world": Desire is called
cnd22:14.2: craving, which is greed.... "In all worlds," in the world of suffering, in the
cnd22:14.3: world of humans, in the world of heaven, in the world of aggregates, in the
cnd22:14.4: world of the world. "Become the one who has no desire in all the worlds": In all
cnd22:14.5: the worlds, become the one who has no desires; become the one who departs from
cnd22:14.6: thirst; after becoming the one who departs from the desire.
cnd22:15.2: Those who show what is of no benefit, those who are fixed on what is wrong,
cnd22:15.3: One should not make friends with those who are devoted (to wrong things) and loose,
cnd22:15.4: But should walk alone like a rhinoceros.
cnd22:15.6: Those who show what is of no benefit, those who are fixed on what is wrong,
cnd22:15.7: One should not make friends with those who are devoted (to wrong things) and loose,
cnd22:15.8: But should walk alone like a rhinoceros.
cnd22:15.10: Those who show what is of no benefit, those who are fixed on what is wrong,
cnd22:15.11: One should not make friends with those who are devoted (to wrong things) and loose,
cnd22:15.12: But should walk alone like a rhinoceros.
cnd22:15.14: Those who show what is of no benefit, those who are fixed on what is wrong,
cnd22:15.15: One should not make friends with those who are devoted (to wrong things) and loose,
cnd22:15.16: But should walk alone like a rhinoceros.
cnd22:16.1: "Should avoid evil companions": Anyone who has ten bases for evil views is
cnd22:16.2: called an evil companion: "There is no charity, no offerings, no good or evil
cnd22:16.3: kamma, no results and rewards. In this world, there is no other world, no
cnd22:16.4: mother, no father, no arisen sentient beings. There is no righteous Samaṇa or
cnd22:16.5: Brāhmaṇa in this world who testifies to this world and other worlds." This is an
cnd22:16.6: evil companion. "Evil companions should be avoided": "Evil companions should be
cnd22:17.1: "The unbeneficial seer, the one who is fixed on the unrighteous": Anyone who has
cnd22:17.2: the bad view, those companions of the ten bases of evil views, is called the
cnd22:17.3: unprofitable seer: "No charity, no support...." "The one who is fixed on the
cnd22:17.4: wrong," the one who is fixed in the wrong body kamma; the one who is fixed in
cnd22:17.5: the wrong language kamma; the one who is fixed in the wrong intention kamma;
cnd22:17.6: those who are fixed in unrighteous killing; those who are fixed when they take
cnd22:17.7: without being given; ...in unrighteous adultery; ...unrighteous deceit;
cnd22:17.8: ...unrighteous separation wrong language; unfair and vulgar language; unjust
cnd22:17.9: vulgar language; unrighteous greed; unfair malice; unfair views; wrong deeds;
cnd22:17.10: five wrong desires; fixed, deeply fixed (attached), stuck, stopped, on the five
cnd22:17.11: wrong covers, to be entered, to be stained, to be turned toward, to be attached,
cnd22:17.12: to be fixed, to be obstructed.
cnd22:18.1: "One should not make friends with those who are keen and loose": "Keen
cnd22:18.2: (enthusiasts)," those who seek and beg on all desires, those with that
cnd22:18.3: character, those who have more, those who value the other, those who target
cnd22:18.4: that, the hardworking person, the ones who lean towards that, the overcomer, and
cnd22:18.5: the uplifter, he is a passionate person. Anyone who is seeking and begging in
cnd22:18.6: all forms because of thirst..., in sound..., (omitted) in smell..., in taste...,
cnd22:18.7: in touch..., ...he is also a passionate one. Whoever gets in the forms because
cnd22:18.8: of thirst..., in the sound..., ....he is also a passionate person. Anyone who is
cnd22:18.9: used in all forms because of thirst..., in sound..., in smell..., in taste...,
cnd22:18.10: in touch.... Enthusiasts, such as critics are enthusiastic about criticism,
cnd22:18.11: workers are enthusiastic about work, those who walk on the path are keen on the
cnd22:18.12: path, and meditators are keen on meditation; in the same way, whoever seeks,
cnd22:18.13: ...is a passionate one. Anyone that is seeking and begging in the various forms
cnd22:18.14: because of thirst.... Whatever is obtained in the various forms because of
cnd22:18.15: thirst.... "Loose (eased, relaxed)" means that in the evil deeds of the body, or
cnd22:18.16: in the evil deeds of speech, or in the evil deeds of the mind, or in the five
cnd22:18.17: desires, letting go can be turned, and the heart's abandonment does not arise.
cnd22:18.18: Or, the state of no respect for the practice of good Dhamma, the state of
cnd22:18.19: impermanence, the state of non-stop working, the state of being stuck to the
cnd22:18.20: habit, the state of neglecting desire, the state of neglecting responsibility,
cnd22:18.21: not practicing not practicing much, not establishing, practicing, letting go
cnd22:18.22: (relaxing). Anything like this state of relaxation, letting go, and ease is
cnd22:19.1: "Oneself should not make friends with those who are enthusiasts and loose": With
cnd22:19.2: those who are enthusiasts one should not make friends; with those who are loose
cnd22:19.3: one should not make friends; they should not make friends, should not engage in,
cnd22:19.4: should not participate, should not be used, should not be practiced, and should
cnd22:19.5: not be practiced fully, and should not be gone on with after accepting.
cnd22:20.1: <em>144 : You should get close to people who learn a lot, those who hold the Dhamma,
cnd22:20.3: After knowing all the benefits and dispelling doubts,
cnd22:20.4: One should walk alone like a rhinoceros.
cnd22:20.5: <em>144 : You should get close to people who learn a lot, those who hold the Dhamma,

cnd22:20.8: One should walk alone like a rhinoceros.

cnd22:20.12: One should walk alone like a rhinoceros.
cnd22:20.13: <em>144 : You should get close to people who learn a lot, those who hold the Dhamma,
cnd22:20.15: After knowing all the benefits and dispelling doubts,
cnd22:20.16: One should walk alone like a rhinoceros.
cnd22:21.1: "Should be close to those who hear (learn) more and those who hold the Dhamma":
cnd22:21.2: Friends are those who hear more, remember what they hear, accumulate what they
cnd22:21.3: hear, and those who start with goodness, the middle is good, and the end is
cnd22:21.4: good; the meaning is correct and the words are correct. He declares that there
cnd22:21.5: is only perfection and purification of Brahma. Such a Dhamma has been heard,
cnd22:21.6: remembered, memorized, observed with the heart, and penetrated with the good.
cnd22:21.7: "Dhamma-holder," remembering of the Dhamma: Suttas, Geyya, Veyyākaraṇa, Gātha,
cnd22:21.8: Udāna, Itivuttaka, Jātaka, Abbhuta Dhamma, Vedalla. "Should be close to those
cnd22:21.9: who hear more and those who hold the Dhamma": Those who hear more and the Dhamma
cnd22:21.10: holders should be close friends, should be completely close, should be obeyed,
cnd22:21.11: one should bend to obey, one should be completely obedient, and should be
cnd22:22.1: "Excellent, eloquent friends": Friends who are excellent in virtue of precept,
cnd22:22.2: concentration, wisdom, liberation, and liberation of wisdom. There are three
cnd22:22.3: types of eloquent people: the learned, the inquisitive, and the proven. What is
cnd22:22.4: a learned debater? Here, a certain type of person is a learner of Buddhist
cnd22:22.5: language (the teachings of the Buddha): Suttas, Verses, ..., appear after
cnd22:23.1: What is a debater who asks repeatedly? Here, a certain type of person is a
cnd22:23.3: characteristics, reasons, possibility and impossibility, and appears after
cnd22:24.1: What is a proven debater? Here, a certain type of person is the attainer of the
cnd22:24.2: four mindfulnesses, the four righteousnesses, the four spiritual bases, the five
cnd22:24.3: senses, the five powers, the seven enlightenment elements, the eight holy paths,
cnd22:24.4: the four Samaṇa fruits, the four debates, and the six magic powers. Those who
cnd22:24.5: have known the reason, the known method, and the known word, the reason is
cnd22:24.6: defended in the known principle, the method appears in the known Dhamma, the
cnd22:24.7: word is defended in the known word, and the three types of wisdom are not
cnd22:24.8: hindered. To understand the wisdom, the one who has the independent
cnd22:24.9: enlightenment arrives, fully arrives, enters, fully enters, has enough, is fully
cnd22:24.10: satisfied, and possesses this type of argument. If he hasn't learned,
cnd22:24.11: questioned, and proved, what will he answer?
cnd22:25.1: "You should get rid of doubt after knowing all the benefits": After knowing your
cnd22:25.2: own interests, you should know the interests of others; after knowing the
cnd22:25.3: interests of the two, after knowing the interests of the current life, after
cnd22:25.4: knowing the interests of the future life, after knowing the highest interest,
cnd22:25.5: after verifying, after understanding, after weighing, after judging, after
cnd22:25.6: separating, after clarifying, suspecting, he will be removed, expelled, cut off,
cnd22:25.7: discarded, terminated, and made to cease to exist.
cnd22:26.2: Joy, desire and pleasure in the world,
cnd22:26.5: With separation from adornment, a truth-speaker,
cnd22:26.6: One should walk alone like a rhinoceros.

cnd22:26.36: One should walk alone like a rhinoceros.
cnd22:27.1: "Entertainment, joy and desire in the world": "Entertainment": There are two
cnd22:27.2: types of entertainment: physical entertainment and verbal entertainment...
cnd22:27.3: (omitted). "Joy," which is synonymous with being satisfied, is "joy." "Desire,"
cnd22:27.4: this is said by the Blessed One [MN.139]: "Bhikkhus! There are five types of
cnd22:27.5: desires, which five types? (Those that) can be known (recognized) by the eye,
cnd22:27.6: which makes for desire, want, greed for form; ...the ear..., nose, tongue, body;
cnd22:27.7: Bhikkhus! These are called the five desires. Bhikkhus! All the happiness and joy
cnd22:27.8: that arise from these five desires, bhikkhus, this is called lust, filthy
cnd22:27.9: happiness, ordinary people's happiness, and vulgar comfort. I said: 'It should
cnd22:27.10: not be practiced, it should not be practiced much, you should be afraid of this
cnd22:27.11: type of happiness.' Bhikkhus! The happiness and joy that arise from these five
cnd22:27.12: desires, bhikkhus! This is called lust." "In the world," in the world of man.
cnd22:28.1: "Become a non-interested one without decoration": In the entertainment and joy
cnd22:28.2: in the world and the pleasure of the world, become non-interested, and without
cnd22:28.3: decoration. After he has given up, driven away, after the end, and making it go
cnd22:29.1: "Separated from the state of decoration, speaking truly": "Decoration," there
cnd22:29.2: are two types of decoration: there are decorations for the resident, and there
cnd22:29.3: are decorations for the non-residents. What is the decoration of the resident?
cnd22:29.4: Hair, beard, wreath, ..., this is the decoration of the layperson.
cnd22:30.1: What is the decoration of non-resident? The decoration of clothes, the
cnd22:30.2: decoration of the bowl, the decoration of the bed, the decoration of the rotten
cnd22:30.3: body or the decoration of necessities, beautification (solemnity), desire to
cnd22:30.4: dress up, well-dressed, greedy state, impetuous state, impetuous and shallow,
cnd22:30.5: this is the decoration of non-residents (bhikkhus).
cnd22:31.1: "True speaker," the one who is alone-enlightened is the true whisperer, the
cnd22:31.2: truthful, the reliable, the trustworthy, and the one who has no deception in the
cnd22:31.3: world. The decorative state has been separated, abstained, quashed, left,
cnd22:31.4: renunciation, unbound, and liberation, he lives with an unrestrained heart.
cnd22:32.3: After giving up all the desires in the scope,
cnd22:32.4: One should walk alone like a rhinoceros.
cnd22:32.7: After giving up all the desires in the scope,
cnd22:32.8: One should walk alone like a rhinoceros.
cnd22:32.11: After giving up all the desires in the scope,
cnd22:32.12: One should walk alone like a rhinoceros.
cnd22:32.15: After giving up all the desires in the scope,
cnd22:32.16: One should walk alone like a rhinoceros.
cnd22:33.1: "Children, wife and parents": "Son," there are four types of sons: sons born to
cnd22:33.2: oneself, sons born in the field, adopted sons, and apprentices. The wife is
cnd22:33.3: called the one who should be supported. "Father," that is the one who gave
cnd22:33.4: produced (one). "Mother," that is the one who gave birth.
cnd22:34.1: "Wealth, grain, and relatives": Gold, gold coins, pearls, orbs, glass, spirals,
cnd22:34.2: rocks, corals, silver, gold, rubies, agate are called wealth (things). Grain
cnd22:34.3: (things): rice, paddy rice, barley, wheat, millet, and grains, are grains (lit.
cnd22:34.4: suitable for curry). "Relations," there are four types of relatives: direct
cnd22:34.5: relatives are relatives, surname relatives are also relatives, sacred relatives
cnd22:34.6: are also relatives, and skill (trade) relatives are also relatives.
cnd22:35.1: "After abandoning all the desires according to the scope": "Desire," there are
cnd22:35.2: two types of desires: .... "After abandoning all desires," after he knows the
cnd22:35.3: desire for things, after abandoning the desire for pollution, after abandoning,
cnd22:35.4: after being driven away, after finishing, and making it go beyond existence.
cnd22:35.5: "After abandoning all the desires according to the scope": Any pollution that is
cnd22:35.6: cut off by the Sotāpanna Path, those pollutions he no longer experiences and
cnd22:35.7: does not return; all the pollution that is cut off by the Sakadāgāmī...; the
cnd22:35.8: pollution that is cut off by the Anāgāmī Path...; the pollution that is cut off
cnd22:35.9: by the Arahant Path will no longer be experienced or return to the pollution.
cnd22:36.1: <em>147 : This is tie, there is little happiness here,
cnd22:36.2: Little (that is) enjoyable, and (there is) more suffering (here),
cnd22:36.3: Like this, this is a fishing hook; after knowing this,
cnd22:36.4: The wise person should walk alone like a rhinoceros.
cnd22:36.5: <em>147 : This is tie, there is little happiness here,
cnd22:36.6: Little (that is) enjoyable, and (there is) more suffering (here),
cnd22:36.7: Like this, this is a fishing hook; after knowing this,
cnd22:36.8: The wise person should walk alone like a rhinoceros.
cnd22:36.9: <em>147 : This is tie, there is little happiness here,
cnd22:36.10: Little (that is) enjoyable, and (there is) more suffering (here),
cnd22:36.11: Like this, this is a fishing hook; after knowing this,
cnd22:36.12: The wise person should walk alone like a rhinoceros.
cnd22:36.13: <em>147 : This is tie, there is little happiness here,
cnd22:36.14: Little (that is) enjoyable, and (there is) more suffering (here),
cnd22:36.15: Like this, this is a fishing hook; after knowing this,
cnd22:36.16: The wise person should walk alone like a rhinoceros.
cnd22:37.1: "This is a tie, there is little happiness here": "Tie," or "crochet," or
cnd22:37.2: "tempting object," or "sticking," or "obstacle," which is synonymous with the
cnd22:37.3: five desires. "Here is little happiness," this is said by the Blessed One:
cnd22:37.4: "Bhikkhus! There are these five desires, which are the five? .... This pleasure
cnd22:37.5: is small; this pleasure is insignificant; this pleasure is only some; this
cnd22:37.6: pleasure is inferior; this pleasure is lesser; this pleasure is lower."
cnd22:38.1: "Less enjoyment and more suffering here": The Blessed One said: "Desire causes
cnd22:38.2: less pleasure but more suffering and more despair, there are more troubles
cnd22:38.3: here;" the Blessed One said: "desire is like a skeleton..., like a piece of
cnd22:38.4: flesh..., like a torch..., a charcoal pit..., dream, a borrowed thing, the fruit
cnd22:38.5: a tree, a slaughterhouse, a sword halberd...;" the Blessed One said: "desire is
cnd22:38.6: like a snake's head, and is bitter and desperate; there are more troubles here."
cnd22:39.1: "Like this, this is the fish hook, the wise one knows it": "hook," or "crochet,"
cnd22:39.2: or "temptation," or "sticking," or "obstacle," which is synonymous with the five
cnd22:39.3: desires. "Like this," the continuation of sentences; the connection of
cnd22:39.4: sentences; the completion of sentences; the combination of words; the connection
cnd22:39.5: of words; this is the order of sentences, which is "like this." "The wise" are
cnd22:39.6: wise, enlightened, differentiated, and wise. "Like this, this is a fishing hook.
cnd22:39.7: The one who knows the wisdom knows it": The one who knows the "hook" knows the
cnd22:39.8: "crochet," knows the "temptation," knows the "sticking," knows the "binding,"
cnd22:39.9: knows the "obstacles;" after knowing he understands, weighs, judges, separates,
cnd22:40.2: Like a fish in the water breaking the net,
cnd22:40.3: Like a fire not returning to the burnt object,
cnd22:40.4: One should walk alone like a rhinoceros.
cnd22:40.6: Like a fish in the water breaking the net,
cnd22:40.7: Like a fire not returning to the burnt object,
cnd22:40.8: One should walk alone like a rhinoceros.
cnd22:40.10: Like a fish in the water breaking the net,
cnd22:40.11: Like a fire not returning to the burnt object,
cnd22:40.12: One should walk alone like a rhinoceros.
cnd22:40.14: Like a fish in the water breaking the net,
cnd22:40.15: Like a fire not returning to the burnt object,
cnd22:40.16: One should walk alone like a rhinoceros.
cnd22:41.1: "After breaking the knots": There are ten types of knots: desire knot, hate
cnd22:41.2: knot, conceit knot, see knot, doubt knot, covetous knot, have greed knot,
cnd22:41.3: jealous knot, miserly knot, and ignorant knot. "After breaking the knots": After
cnd22:41.4: the ten types of knots are broken, driven away, after finishing, and making them
cnd22:42.1: "Like a fish in the water after breaking a net": The net is called a rope net,
cnd22:42.2: the water (salilaṃ) is called water (udakaṃ), and the fish (ambucārī) is called
cnd22:42.3: fish (maccho). Like a fish destroys, completely destroys, and breaks, the net is
cnd22:42.4: completely broken and completely broken, it walks, lives, moves, goes on,
cnd22:42.5: guards, and survives. Similarly, there are two types of nets: thirst nets and
cnd22:42.6: seeing nets.... For the one who is enlightened, the thirst net has been cut off,
cnd22:42.7: and the seeing net has been cut off. In the state where the thirst net has been
cnd22:42.8: cut off, the saw net has been cut off. In the state of mindfulness, that
cnd22:42.9: individual who is enlightened is not adhered to form, sound, or smell...
cnd22:42.10: (omitted); seeing, hearing, perceiving, and being aware of the dhammas, they are
cnd22:42.11: not adhered to, captured, bound, not unconscious, separated, left, liberated,
cnd22:42.12: already leaving the bondage, he lives with the unrestrained heart.
cnd22:43.1: "As the fire does not turn back to the burned object": As the fire burns grass
cnd22:43.2: fuel, it goes until it does not turn back, and the same, for the
cnd22:43.3: alone-enlightened person, all the pollution that is cut off by the Sotāpanna
cnd22:44.1: <em>149 : Those whose eyes are downward and those who do not wander,
cnd22:44.2: Those who guard the roots, those who protect the mind,
cnd22:44.3: Those who have no pollutions and are not burned all over (with passion),
cnd22:44.5: <em>149 : Those whose eyes are downward and those who do not wander,
cnd22:44.6: Those who guard the roots, those who protect the mind,
cnd22:44.7: Those who have no pollutions and are not burned all over (with passion),
cnd22:44.9: <em>149 : Those whose eyes are downward and those who do not wander,
cnd22:44.10: Those who guard the roots, those who protect the mind,
cnd22:44.11: Those who have no pollutions and are not burned all over (with passion),
cnd22:44.13: <em>149 : Those whose eyes are downward and those who do not wander,
cnd22:44.14: Those who guard the roots, those who protect the mind,
cnd22:44.15: Those who have no pollutions and are not burned all over (with passion),
cnd22:45.1: "The one with the eyes down and the one that does not wander": How are the eyes
cnd22:45.2: confused? Here, the bhikkhu is an restless in the eyes: what should be seen
cnd22:45.3: becomes invisible, and what should be crossed (over) becomes seen. From the
cnd22:45.4: garden to the garden, from the village to the village, from the town to the
cnd22:45.5: town, from the city to the city, from the country to the country, from the place
cnd22:45.6: to the place, he sees the long parades (processions) and occasional parades in
cnd22:46.1: Or, when the bhikkhu is a visitor at home, a walker on the street, he walks
cnd22:46.2: unprotected: he looks at the elephant, the horse, the cart, the infantry, the
cnd22:46.3: boy, and the girl as he walks. Watching women, watching men, watching the
cnd22:46.4: market, watching the door of the house, watching the top, watching the bottom,
cnd22:47.1: Or, after the bhikkhu sees a form with his eyes, he becomes a grasper of
cnd22:47.2: appearance and a grasper of subtle appearance, because when he stays at the root
cnd22:47.3: of his eyes, greed, sorrow and evil will flow in. He does not act according to
cnd22:47.4: his self-control, does not protect the roots of the eyes, and does not achieve
cnd22:47.5: self-control [SN.35.120] of the roots of the eyes.
cnd22:48.1: Or if some Samaṇas and Brāhmaṇa masters received food offered by faith, they
cnd22:48.2: dwelt at performances and watched like this: dancing, singing, music, drama,
cnd22:48.3: speaking about ancient times, handbells, cymbals, drums, magic, iron balls,
cnd22:48.4: bamboo stick play, stunts, elephant fighting, horse fighting, buffalo fighting,
cnd22:48.5: bull fighting, goat fighting, ram fighting, rooster fighting, quail fighting,
cnd22:48.6: club fighting, fist fighting, wrestling, exercises, drills, army formations,
cnd22:48.7: military parade [DN.1], etc., who are engaged in watching various performances
cnd22:49.1: How is the eye down? Here, the bhikkhu is not a person with unstable eyes, and
cnd22:49.2: one who does not possess (restless) eyes: what should be seen becomes
cnd22:49.3: invisible..., from places to places, he didn't want to see long parades and
cnd22:50.1: Or, when the bhikkhu is a visitor to the home, a walker on the street, he walks
cnd22:50.2: protectively: he does not look at the elephant while walking, does not look at
cnd22:50.3: the horse, ...the cart..., ...the infantry..., does not look at all directions.
cnd22:51.1: Or, after the bhikkhu sees the form with his eyes, he does not become a grasper
cnd22:51.2: of the form or a grasper of the subtle form, because when he stays at the root
cnd22:51.3: of the eye, greed, sorrow and evil will flow in, and he will act according to
cnd22:51.4: his self-control, protect the root of the eye and achieve self-control of the
cnd22:52.1: Or if some Samaṇas and Brāhmaṇa masters received the food offered by faith, they
cnd22:52.2: did not dwell at at the performances and watch like this, that is: dancing,
cnd22:52.3: singing, music... (omitted), avoiding watching the performances like this.
cnd22:53.1: "And not wandering," how is it wandering? Here, a certain type of bhikkhu is a
cnd22:53.2: wanderer, with wandering nature: from garden to garden, ..., from place to
cnd22:53.3: place, he lives engaged in long parades and irregular parades.
cnd22:54.1: Or a wandering bhikkhu in the bhikkhu's garden, wandering: for no benefit, no
cnd22:54.2: reason, uprooted, quietly walking from the bhikkhu's room to the bhikkhu's room,
cnd22:54.3: from residence to residence, from half-roof house..., from high-rise..., flat
cnd22:54.4: house, cave, hut, pavilion,observation deck, tent, shed, lecture hall, round
cnd22:54.5: house, tree, or where the bhikkhus sit, and he walks there, where the first
cnd22:54.6: becomes the second, or the second position becomes the third position, or the
cnd22:54.7: third position becomes the fourth position. There is a lot of miscellaneous
cnd22:54.8: talking there, namely: the theory (talk) of kings, of thieves, ministers, army,
cnd22:54.9: fear, war, food, beverage, clothing, bedding, garland, smell, kinship, cart
cnd22:54.10: ride, village, town, city, land, woman, (man theory,) hero, street, water well,
cnd22:54.11: ancestor spirit, various things, world origin, ocean origin, and so on [DN.1].
cnd22:55.1: "One who does not wander," the one who has been separated from wandering, has
cnd22:55.2: abstained, has given up, has left, has been freed, has separated from the
cnd22:55.3: bondage, and is happy to be alone with an unrestrained heart. The sitting
cnd22:55.4: person, the person who likes to sit alone, the practitioner of inner cessation,
cnd22:55.5: the person who does not despise the jhāna, has the observer, and increases the
cnd22:55.6: vacant house, the meditator, the jhāna-loving person, the singular practitioner,
cnd22:55.7: and the admirer of his own interests.
cnd22:56.1: "The one who protects the root, the one who protects the mind": "The one who
cnd22:56.2: protects the root," The one who, seeing form with his eyes, does not become a
cnd22:56.3: grasper of appearance, a grasper of details, because he when he lives at the
cnd22:56.4: root of the eye he is unprotected, greed, sorrow and evil will flow in. He acts
cnd22:56.5: according to his self-control, protects the eye roots, achieves self-control at
cnd22:56.6: the eye roots; when he listens to sounds with his ears..., after smelling with
cnd22:56.7: his nose..., after tasting the taste of the tongue..., touching the touch with
cnd22:56.8: the body..., after knowing the Dhamma with consciousness, he will not become the
cnd22:56.9: grasper of the aspect, the grasper of the subtle aspect, because when the mind
cnd22:56.10: is not protected, he will be greedy and worried, evil and unwholesome dhammas
cnd22:56.11: will flow in, and he will act according to his self-control, protect the root of
cnd22:56.12: mind, and achieve self-control on the root of mind The "protective mind" is the
cnd22:57.1: "Those who have no leaks (pollution) and are not burned all over": This is said
cnd22:57.2: by the Venerable Moggallāna [SN.35.243]: "Mendicants! I will teach you about
cnd22:57.3: leaking and not leaking. You have to listen! Be careful! I'm going to say it."
cnd22:58.1: "Mendicants! What is a leaker? Mendicants! Here, after seeing the form with his
cnd22:58.2: eyes, the bhikkhu falls in love with the desirable form, rejects the unlovable
cnd22:58.3: form, lives without establishing mindfulness of the body, and their heart is
cnd22:58.4: limited. Liberation: the evil and unwholesome dhammas that have arisen have no
cnd22:58.5: end; after hearing the sound with ears... (omitted), after knowing the dhamma
cnd22:58.6: with consciousness, fall in love with the lovable dhamma, reject the unlovable
cnd22:58.7: dhamma, live in the body and have no thoughts, without the truth of mind relief,
cnd22:58.8: freedom from wisdom, and wisdom liberation: those evil and unwholesome dhammas
cnd22:58.9: that have arisen have no extinguishment, fellow students! This is called the
cnd22:58.10: bhikkhu who is the leaker in the form that can be recognized by the eye....
cnd22:58.11: Students! When the Bhikkhu lives like this, if the demon approaches him from the
cnd22:58.12: eyes, the demon gets the opportunity and the demon gets the object; if the demon
cnd22:58.13: approaches him from the ear... (omitted;) if the demon approaches him
cnd22:58.14: intentionally he, the devil, gets the opportunity, the devil gets the object.
cnd22:59.1: Mendicants! It is like a reed house or thatched house that has been dry for
cnd22:59.2: three or four years. If a man approaches it with a burning torch from the east,
cnd22:59.3: the fire will get the opportunity and the fire will get the object; if the man
cnd22:59.4: is from the west... (omitted), if from the north..., if From the south..., if
cnd22:59.5: from below..., if from above..., if a man approaches it with a burning torch no
cnd22:59.6: matter which direction it is from, the fire will get the opportunity and the
cnd22:59.7: fire will get the object. Similarly, fellow students! When the bhikkhu lives
cnd22:59.8: like this, if the demon approaches him from the eye, the demon gets the
cnd22:59.9: opportunity and the demon gets the object; if the demon is from the ear....
cnd22:60.1: Mendicants! When living like this, form conquers bhikkhus rather than bhikkhus
cnd22:60.2: conquering form; ...sound...; smell...; taste....; touches....; Dhamma...;
cnd22:60.3: fellow students! This is called a bhikkhu who is conquered by form, conquered by
cnd22:60.4: sound, conquered by smell, conquered by taste, conquered by touch, conquered by
cnd22:60.5: Dhamma; conquered, not conqueror; polluted, reborn, and distressed; retribution,
cnd22:60.6: he will be killed by the evil dhamma of life and death in the future. Friends!
cnd22:61.1: Mendicants! How is it not to leak? Friends! Here, after seeing form with his
cnd22:61.2: eyes, the bhikkhu does not fall in love with the desirable form, does not reject
cnd22:61.3: the undesirable, lives having established mindfulness of the body, with an
cnd22:61.4: unrestrained heart, immeasurable, truthfully knowing the mind, and liberated by
cnd22:61.5: wisdom; the evil and unwholesome dhammas that arise can be destroyed. After
cnd22:61.6: hearing the sound... (omitted), and liberate from wisdom: there is no end to the
cnd22:61.7: evil and unwholesome Dhamma that arises, fellow students! This is called a
cnd22:61.8: bhikkhu who does not leak out in terms of the forms that can be recognized by
cnd22:61.9: the eye.... Friends! When the bhikkhu lives in this way, if the demon approaches
cnd22:61.10: him from the eyes, the demon neither gets the opportunity nor the object; if
cnd22:61.11: from the ear... (omitted) if the demon approaches him intentionally, the demon
cnd22:61.12: neither gets the chance, nor the object.
cnd22:62.1: Mendicants! It is like a heavy pavilion or a lecture hall newly coated with
cnd22:62.2: thick clay. If a man approaches it with a burning torch from the east, the fire
cnd22:62.3: will neither have a chance nor an object; if it is from the west..., no matter
cnd22:62.4: which direction it is from, the fire will neither get the chance nor the object.
cnd22:62.5: Similarly, fellow students! When the bhikkhu lives like this, if the demon
cnd22:62.6: approaches him from the eye, the demon will neither get the opportunity nor the
cnd22:62.7: object..., if the demon approaches him deliberately, the demon will neither get
cnd22:63.1: Mendicants! When living in this way, bhikkhus conquer form are not conquered by
cnd22:63.3: students! This is called the bhikkhu conquering form, conquering sound,
cnd22:63.4: conquering smell, conquering taste, conquering touch, conquering the Dhamma; the
cnd22:63.5: conqueror, not the conquered; he conquers the polluted, regenerated, distressed,
cnd22:63.6: and bitter, the evil and unwholesome Dhamma of life and death in the future.
cnd22:63.7: Friends! This is the one who does not leak."
cnd22:64.1: "Those who are not burned all over," those who are not burnt by the scorching
cnd22:64.2: heat of greed; those who are not burned by the scorching heat of anger; those
cnd22:64.3: who are not burned by the scorching heat of ignorance.
cnd22:65.1: <em>150 : After leaving the marks of the family member (layperson),
cnd22:65.2: Like a pāricchattaka tree covered with leaves,
cnd22:65.3: In the yellow robes, after leaving home,
cnd22:65.4: One should walk alone like a rhinoceros.
cnd22:65.5: <em>150 : After leaving the marks of the family member (layperson),
cnd22:65.6: Like a pāricchattaka tree covered with leaves,
cnd22:65.7: In the yellow robes, after leaving home,
cnd22:65.8: One should walk alone like a rhinoceros.
cnd22:65.9: <em>150 : After leaving the marks of the family member (layperson),
cnd22:65.10: Like a pāricchattaka tree covered with leaves,
cnd22:65.11: In the yellow robes, after leaving home,
cnd22:65.12: One should walk alone like a rhinoceros.
cnd22:65.13: <em>150 : After leaving the marks of the family member (layperson),
cnd22:65.14: Like a pāricchattaka tree covered with leaves,
cnd22:65.15: In the yellow robes, after leaving home,
cnd22:65.16: One should walk alone like a rhinoceros.
cnd22:66.1: "After taking off the mark of the layman": hair, beard..., are called the mark
cnd22:66.2: of the layman. "After taking off the mark of the family member": After the
cnd22:66.3: family member's mark is abandoned, after completely abandoning, after putting
cnd22:67.1: "Like a pāricchattaka tree covered with leaves": Like the pāricchattaka tree
cnd22:67.2: with dense leaves and thick shade. Similarly, that alone-enlightened person is a
cnd22:67.3: perfect mantle-bearer. (Some translations of this sutta use "...having shed its
cnd22:67.4: leaves;" this seems in line with previous verses and makes sense in context, but
cnd22:67.5: does not seem to be what is literally written here).
cnd22:68.1: "In the robes, after leaving home": The single-conscious person cut off all
cnd22:68.2: obstacles of the house, cut off the obstacles of his children and wife, ...of
cnd22:68.3: relatives, ...friends, ...storage; after removing the obstacles, shaved hair and
cnd22:68.4: beard, wrapped in robes, went from home to a non-domestic (monastic) life, and
cnd22:68.5: began to walk alone, live, act, go on, guard, and survive, after becoming in a
